sense.gloss: to gather, to crowd round, to swarm, to flock
to sponge (off someone), to scrounge, to pester (someone for something), to bum, to cadge
to extort, to take (money) through intimidation

sdata.j: その↑男↑↓おとこ↓はいつも↑私↑↓わたし↓に↑金↑↓きん↓を|たかる|。
sdata.e: The man always cadges money from me.

sdata.j: ↑１９５１↑↓せんきゅうひゃくごじゅういち↓↑年↑↓ねん↓にシスター・テレサは↑当時↑↓とうじ↓インド↑最大↑↓さいだい↓の↑都市↑↓とし↓であっ|たカル|カッタに↑派遣↑↓はけん↓された。
sdata.e: In 1951, Sister Teresa was sent to Calcutta, then the largest city in India.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑働↑↓はたら↓かないで↑親類↑↓しんるい↓に|たかる|ことばかり↑考↑↓かんが↓えている。
sdata.e: He doesn't work, but only thinks of sponging off his relatives.

sdata.j: 「↑先輩↑↓せんぱい↓、お↑昼↑↓ひる↓ご↑飯↑↓はん↓、↑奢↑↓おご↓ってください！」「いつもいつも↑集↑↓|たか↓る|な」「いいじゃないですかぁ。↑先輩↑↓せんぱい↓、↑昨日↑↓きのう↓、バイト↑代↑↓だい↓が↑入↑↓はい↓ったんでしょ？」「↑仕方↑↓しかた↓ないな。↑何↑↓なに↓↑食↑↓た↓べに↑行↑↓い↓く？」
sdata.e: Senpai, please treat me to lunch! "You should stop forever sponging off of me." "It's alright isn't it? Didn't you get payment from your part time job yesterday?" "I guess it can't be helped. What do you want to eat?"
